intro: Hookera lemmoniae, commonly known as the Lemmon's hooker's flower, is a rare and alpine plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, which help protect it from harsh weather. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hookera lemmoniae is considered a rare and endangered species.
